background.title: Background
background.p1: Jubaland's energy sector mixes traditional and modern sources, with a growing focus on renewables. Many households rely on diesel generators and biomass, while efforts are underway to expand clean, sustainable energy. Challenges include weak infrastructure, high tariffs, and limited grid connectivity. Abundant solar and wind give strong potential, and the government is working to attract investment, raise electrification, and improve efficiency. The Energy Department within the Ministry develops policies, regulates the sector, oversees infrastructure, and ensures a sustainable, reliable supply with teams spanning engineers, specialists and technicians.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: To become a leading institution in energy sector transformation, driving growth and social development through sustainable, innovative, and inclusive energy solutions in Jubaland State.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: Ensure reliable, affordable, and sustainable energy access for all by building resilient infrastructure, promoting renewable investment, and implementing policies that support growth and environmental sustainability.

objectives.title: Objectives
objectives.text: Expand access, ensure sustainability, and promote renewable adoption through policy, regulation, and strategic investments that modernize the sector and support private engagement.

demand.title: Energy Demand and Supply
demand.p1: Demand is rising due to population growth, urbanization, and economic activity. Supply remains insufficient and expensive with high tariffs tied to diesel.

sectors.households: Households — rely on biomass and diesel generators for lighting and cooking.
sectors.commercial: Commercial & Industrial — need stable supply but face high costs and outages.
sectors.public: Public Services — health, schools, and government face unreliability limiting service delivery.

demand.p2: Installed capacity is inadequate and grid extension is slow. Solar home systems and mini-grids are growing.

rationale.title: Rationale for the Reform of Energy Sector

items.0: Expand affordable, reliable energy via renewables and grid development.
items.1: Reduce diesel dependence with solar, wind and hybrid solutions.
items.2: Strengthen regulation and policy to attract private investment.
items.3: Develop human capital with training in energy and renewables.
items.4: Build PPPs to leverage resources for large projects.
items.5: Improve rural electrification with off-grid solar and mini-grids.
items.6: Increase efficiency and sustainability including clean cooking.
